overview: This subject focuses on understanding the procedures involved in breeding crops and the role of genetics in the process.The integration of conventional breeding approaches and the use of gene technologies in breeding new crop varieties are explored. Emphasis is placed on how plant breeders identify priority traits and the management of breeding programs in a commercial setting. The practical sessions aim to develop skills in plant breeding methodologies and research techniques.
Domestication of crop species and conservation of plant genetic resources
Evolutionary processes and genetic variability of plant populations
Methods of breeding self– and cross-pollinating plants
Supplementary breeding approaches including mutation breeding
The use of molecular biology techniques in plant breeding
Genetics of important crops within the Australian agricultural context and discussion of priority traits for improvement
intended learning outcomes: Evaluate trait inheritance and determine the most suitable methods to dissect the genetic factors of a trait
Explain how and why molecular techniques are used to facilitate the identification of genetic elements to improve crop production
Distinguish differences in breeding programs based on the crop type and breeding objectives
Critique the role of traditional breeding methods and gene technology approaches in the production and commercialization of new crop varieties

additional pre-requisite: BIOL10005	Genetics and The Evolution of Life

Semester 2.Contact hours: 2 x 1 hr lectures per week (24 hours), and 1x2hr practicals per week (9 weeks, 18 hours)

Prescribed texts: There are no specifically prescribed or recommended texts for this subject.

About the Community Access Program (CAP): This subject is available through theCommunity Access Program(also called Single Subject Studies) which allows you to enrol in single subjects offered by the University of Melbourne, without the commitment required to complete a whole degree.
Entry requirements including prerequisites may apply. Please refer to theCAP applications pagefor further information.

Available to Study Abroad and/or Study E: This subject is available to students studying at the University from eligible overseas institutions on exchange and study abroad. Students are required to satisfy any listed requirements, such as pre- and co-requisites, for enrolment in the subject.
